Introducing Alex Jackson, the Pea Ridge Clinic and Community Coordinator!

Alex previously taught in Springdale at Don Tyson School of Innovation where she served as the Coordinator of Accelerated Programs and Senior Seminar Teacher. In 2019 Alex partnered with Northwest Medical Center Springdale to create the BOLD Internship program, allowing medical pathway students opportunities to shadow different positions in the hospital.

She has two boys, her stepson is in kindergarten at Pea Ridge Primary School and we have a one-year-old. Alex has a master's in educational administration and an undergraduate in business education.

"My favorite thing about Pea Ridge is the sense of community, I'm excited to be a part of that." - Alex Jackson

All 5th and 6th grade face-to-face students and staff will engage remotely on this date. We will follow the schedule attached for remote learning utilizing Schoology. Parents and students can find more information in our Blended Learning Plan here: https://bit.ly/329imWv and on the Pea Ridge Ready to Learn page www.pearidgek12.com. We are currently tracing all probable close contacts; they will be contacted individually and will be directed to quarantine. If you are not contacted individually, then your child was not considered a probable close contact. All other Pea Ridge campuses will continue to learn on-site.

Little fingerprints, eraser marks... all of the things. We know those Chromebooks might not be in the best shape of their existence.

To clean your child's device:
1. Power off and unplug
2. Use compressed air to blow off dust and particles
3. Use a disinfectant wipe or cloth with a bit of rubbing alcohol. For smears that are hard to get, use light pressure but be careful with the display area as significant pressure and damage it.
4. After it dries, use a microfiber cloth to wipe the device

It's National Counselor Week (February 3-7), so we would like to acknowledge our wonderful counselors!

Holly Dayberry
Cathy Caudle
Sarah Engle
Tina Robinson
Lauren Coles

National School Counseling Week provides recognition for the role school counselors play in the life of a student. School counselors are the first line of support for students. Students can't achieve academically when they can't cope with social and emotional problems, so they have a tremendous impact on students' academic achievement.

Pea Ridge has the most amazing team of counselors who work tirelessly to not only support our students but our families and community as well. Thank you, to our counselors who sacrifice their time and efforts to make a difference in the lives of so many. Thank you for your commitment to the potential of students in Pea Ridge. You inspire everyone around you, and we are grateful.

We want to introduce you to Amanda Childs!

Amanda is our Pea Ridge School District's Social Worker. She is a trained mental health professional with a degree in social work. Amanda provides services related to a person's social, emotional, and life adjustments to school and society. School Social Workers are the link between the home, school, and community. They provide direct as well as indirect services to students, families, and school personnel to promote and support students' academic and social success. Amanda works with our school counselors and School Resource Officers to address social-emotional learning, school safety, attendance concerns, and to increase the accessibility of resources to the community. She serves as the Foster Care Liaison, the McKinney Vento Liaison, and leads the Blackhawk Ambassadors at the high school.

We encourage families to contact Amanda if they need community resources such as food, utilities, housing, etc.

Contact: achilds@pearidgek12.com
